results.title: A Case of depression
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the problems of diagnosing depression and treating it. Follows the experience of a suicidal patient through shock therapy and questions the effectiveness of this crude technique. Shows a leucotomy operation which cures a woman of a 9-year depression, but asks how much can be done for the ordinary depressed patient. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.title: Ghost of the Amoco Cadiz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
In 40 years three major maritime casualties have changed the way ships are worked. The ghost of the biggest accident, the Amoco Cadiz, haunts the shipping industry, and a great deal of research work has been stimulated by the events of that fateful day.

results.title: Koestler on creativity
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Vas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Arthur Koestler discusses some of the mental processes underlying the creative act, conscious and unconscious. He defines the creative act as occurring through the “bisociation” of two existing ideas to create something not seen before. Compares the methods of the artist and scientist to show their similarities.

results.title: The Structure of life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
A look at Ernst Chain, a volatile and gifted man, who together with Sir Alexander Fleming and Lord Flory, was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1945, for his work on penicillin. He now runs the Biochemistry Department at Imperial College, London. Shows some of the remarkable work now in progress under his direction.

results.title: Now the chips are down
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Edward Goldwyn
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Examines the role of the computer in today’s society. Discusses the development and manufacturing of the silicon chip- or microprocessor- which will totally revolutionise our way of life. Shows changes which have already occurred in the factory, office, farm and shop and explains the implications for future societies.

results.title: The Spike
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documentary which explains the disease of epilepsy and looks at research which is being done into its causes and how to treat it. Includes extensive interviews with epilepsy sufferers who describe their symptoms and their feelings about the disease and the social stigma attached to it. Presented and narrated by Dr Peter Fenwick.

results.title: The River that came clean
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Christopher Riley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
An environmental success story that begins by emphasising the role of sewage as a major pollutant of the River Thames since the mid 19th century. Shows evidence of the great increase in fish and bird life after a cleaning process was instigated. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Crab nebula (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Alec Nisbett
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Discusses the research being carried out on the Crab Nebula, and examines the deductions that astronomers are making from the results of their studies.

results.title: Brave new babies?
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, David Dugan and Oliver Morse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Introduces some of the new developments in genetic engineering including gene mapping, cloning and embryo manipulation. Argues that we should sort out our attitude to genetic engineering now before biology catches up with science fiction.

results.title: Pedal power
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A new look at the self-propelled bicycle, the most effective known way of translating energy into motion. Traces the development of the bicycle and examines the bicycle’s possible role in the modern transport scene in the light of the present world fuel crisis.
